1: [a]Praise [b]the Lord! Praise the Lord, O my soul!
2: I will praise the Lord while I live; I will sing praises to my God while I have my being.
3: Do not trust in princes, In [c]mortal man, in whom there is no salvation.
4: His spirit departs, he returns to [d]the earth; In that very day his thoughts perish.
5: How blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob, Whose hope is in the Lord his God,
6: Who made heaven and earth, The sea and all that is in them; Who keeps [e]faith forever;
7: Who executes justice for the oppressed; Who gives food to the hungry. The Lord sets the prisoners free.
8: The Lord opens the eyes of the blind; The Lord raises up those who are bowed down; The Lord loves the righteous;
9: The Lord [f]protects the [g]strangers; He [h]supports the fatherless and the widow, But He [i]thwarts the way of the wicked.
10: The Lord will reign forever, Your God, O Zion, to all generations. [j]Praise [k]the Lord!
